isis.stitle: TSI 92-08-11 - Removing and Replacing Factory Installed Panasonic, Alpine and Technics Radios

subjectgroup.subject: Removing and Replacing Factory Installed Panasonic, Alpine and Technics Radios

geninfo.para: This TSI describes the removing and replacing of radios in certain model vehicles.

step1.para: Radios installed in 2000, 4000 and 8000 models use a "DIN" mount and can be removed by using the removal tools provided in the radio instruction package.

Radios installed in 5000 and 9000 models are mounted in brackets which are secured with theft protective screws. Tools to remove the theft protective screws are available from your local Snap-On, Mac, Matco, etc. tool distributors.

The radio removal tools used for 2000, 4000 and 8000 models will not work on 5000 and 9000 models. Attempts to do so can damage the radio. Also, never pry on radio face plates - they are not removable. Attempts to do so will damage the radio.
Radios from 5000 and 9000 models returned under warranty must include the mounting bracket. Do not remove radio from mounting bracket. Replacement radios will include a new mounting bracket.
Radios from 2000, 4000 and 8000 models returned under warranty must include the rubber bumper mounted on the back side. Replacement radios will include a new bumper.
Panasonic and Technics radios include a removable radio harness. If these radios are returned under warranty, the harness must also be returned. Replacement radios will include a new harness.
Warranty on radios whose harnesses have been cut into or spliced will not be honored.
Radios returned under warranty should be returned using the same box the replacement radio arrived in.
